content.html:
@jepyang The original hardware is absolutely fabulous. Dedicated cab, colour(!) vector graphics (it was one of the earliest machines to use that display tech, I think), *perfectly* weighted spinner, gorgeously clicky buttons (quite small, not like modern arcade buttons at all, but great all the same).

And you're dead right about the hackiness of #gameDad gear. On a good day, I love it. On a bad day, I hate all the sharp edges – I just want to play video games, dammit!

gamedad

content.html:
@pdcawley Oh jeez I had forgotten all about Tempest until right now. I never played the arcade version but had a port or clone of it for the family computer in the 90s.

I do really appreciate the hackiness of #gameDad hardware. Not opposed to more polish but it *is* really dang cool how everything is just…there…for you to play with as you like.
